channel.title: Need help editing client login screen
channel.description:
I've managed to change the colour of the "Click here to log in" box by editing the colours in the Menu.java file, and also been able to move where the box 'appears' on the client log in screen, but I've been unable to change where the 'clickable' area for the box is.
In other words, I still have to click where the old "Click here to log in" box was even though the box appears to be in the bottom right corner! I need to get this fixed please :P
Thanks :)

item.title: Need help editing client login screen
item.dc:creator: @dimebagx dimebagx
item.description:
@dimebagx wrote:

Yeah,it isn’t but it’s an example no c&p anyone with a brain could figure that out,
simply by searching for “click on an option” its just not refactored

item.title: Need help editing client login screen
item.dc:creator: @RSCShadow RSCShadow
item.description:
@RSCShadow wrote:

I’m not sure what dimebagx posted, but you also have to move the button where you moved the box. The “button” actually does the action, the box and text just display it.

Read full topic
item.source: Need help editing client login screen

item.title: Need help editing client login screen
item.dc:creator: @dimebagx dimebagx
item.description:
@dimebagx wrote:

okay, I don’t know what src your using, but i’ve just come across this too,
it should be in mudclient.java,
Think of it as you don’t click the button, but you click the position,
it draws the box, it draws the texts, and sets the boundaries where you click, example,

        eki.gfd(256, 200 + l, "Click on an option", 5, true);

        eki.gfd(156, 240 + l, "Info/Help", 5, false);
        eki.gfe(156, 240 + l, 120, 35);
        eea = eki.gfl(156, 240 + l, 120, 35);

        eki.gfd(356, 240 + l, "Log In", 5, false);
        eki.gfe(356, 240 + l, 120, 35);
        eeb = eki.gfl(356, 240 + l, 120, 35);

to center that you’d want to change the ‘356’ to ‘256’
(:

Read full topic
item.source: Need help editing client login screen
